name: Create Your Business Plan
description: Writing a business plan is an important first step to get your business up and running. An effective business plan will serve as a roadmap for the decisions you need to make, helping you obtain financing, build relationships, attract good employees, and boost your confidence as a business owner.

name: Prepare to Register Your Business
description: Before you officially form and register your business, it’s important to research and prepare for any location or industry specific permits or requirements. Doing this before you actually register your business can save you time and money later.

name: Register Your Business with the State and Federal Government
description: Once you’ve confirmed your business location, it’s time to officially register with the State. In this step you’ll identify your desired business name, create your legal entity, and register for New Jersey State taxes.

name: Comply with Industry Specific and Local Laws
description: After registering your business, you have the opportunity to legally sign agreements in your businesses’ name. You may choose to do this for your lease and/or insurance policy. You now also have the information you need to apply for local permits or industry site-specific requirements.

name: Meet Inspection Requirements
description: Once your business is up and running, your business will be inspected by local and/or State government to ensure that there are safe conditions for workers and customers.
